acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.293mg/L of the fish (Carp) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >=5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 5.8mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,480mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group D by EPA.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.28 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 92.5-94.5degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on any of the in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1987), chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1982) and DNA repair tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1987)) and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1981).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 2-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)) and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 92.5-94.5degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea-pig skin sensitization studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, testis)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat subacute toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including hepatocellular swelling and testicular atrophy were noted (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including reduced locomotor activity, crouching position and prone position were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
